column2: The Middle Ages were a period of very complex social division. Society was divided into many rulers by the priests, the chefs, and the aristocracy.
In those days, all of Europe was divided into several factions, many of which were given leadership. This contributed to many attacks and wars between the kingdoms.
Fields of science developed during the Middle Ages, primarily medicine and pharmaceuticals. Some plants are considered medicinal, and advances in medical research are happening in Europe.
The medieval period also saw innovations in the field of architecture and art. Magnificent buildings and churches were built, and a common symbolic approach was also in art.

In the 14th century, Medisheva entered a black century and European knowledge rapidly declined. At the end of the Middle Ages, new movements began to develop and a new interest in ancient studies arose.
